Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: Helping people in need is what we stand for as Americans
column26: O1: Other/Independent, O2: 35-44, O3: Urban, older independents

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: Human rights are extremely important and when one country degrades them, others tend to follow, leading to a decomposition of the world order. Thus defending them wherever strategically possible without the risks outweighing the benefits seems most sensible.
column26: O1: Democrat, O2: 45-54, O3: Suburban, older democrats

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: I believe we should help the disadvantaged.
column26: O1: Democrat, O2: 65+, O3: Suburban, older democrats

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: I think the US as a highly developed and top nation should focus on the areas of the worst human rights violations and support efforts to reduce and remove those violations.  We need proof, a clear plan, and strong execution as key pieces before we interfere.
column26: O1: Republican, O2: 45-54, O3: Suburban, older republicans (>35)

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: If we see suffering among vulnerable people in the world, we have a moral obligation to help. I'm thinking of Syrian refugees, Ukrainians, civilians under attack in Gaza, women being oppressed in Iran, people living under dictatorships in Cuba, Venezuela and Russia. Our help doesn't always mean weapons or military force, though.
column26: O1: Democrat, O2: 55-64, O3: Suburban, older democrats

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: The concept of fundamental human rights is enshrined in the Declaration of Independence and other founding documents. Promoting these values abroad reflects the core principles of the United States
column26: O1: Other/Independent, O2: 25-34, O3: Suburban, young independents

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: This isn't a zero-sum game. Helping the world helps us. It is both the most morale and most beneficial choice.
column26: O1: Democrat, O2: 18-24, O3: Suburban, young democrats

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: I think we are the most prosperous country on Earth in terms of economics, so I think we should help out countries that are in need of assistance if we agree with their ideals. We can get an ally and I think it is morally correct.
column26: O1: Other/Independent, O2: 18-24, O3: Urban, young independents

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: I do believe in global citizenship, and therefore, the entire planet should be concerned with human rights and try to defend them.
column26: O1: Other/Independent, O2: 45-54, O3: Rural, older independents

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: We are a world leader, so we need to lead. If we have all of this wealth and power and influence, what else should we do with it besides trying to make the world a more just place?
column26: O1: Other/Independent, O2: 45-54, O3: Suburban, older independents

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: As much as  it pains me for us to get involved (as it costs money and can cost lives and gain us enemies) I think we need to stand up for and support what is right. We need to be on "the right side of history" and not just sit back and let bad things happen.
column26: O1: Other/Independent, O2: 45-54, O3: Suburban, older independents

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: I believe this because we should all want to help people with their rights as long as it's actual basic right not just things the government is trying to push on people
column26: O1: Other/Independent, O2: 35-44, O3: Rural, older independents

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: I think we need to ensure our own people are safe and definitely take a stand on global human rights.  I just don't know that we need to be involved in everything.
column26: O1: Republican, O2: 45-54, O3: Suburban, older republicans (>35)

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: We're all impacted by global events and we're all humans deserving of fair treatment, safety and well being.
column26: O1: Democrat, O2: 55-64, O3: Suburban, older democrats

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: If a situation is out of control and a country or it’s people are in a crisis and need help america should step in and provide some humanitarian relief.
column26: O1: Democrat, O2: 18-24, O3: Urban, young democrats

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: Because human rights should be protected no matter what
column26: O1: Republican, O2: 35-44, O3: Rural, older republicans (>35)

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: I think all countries should act in the best interest of all humanity which includes protecting human rights. It doesn't need to be the only goal of American policy but it should always be a consideration and US policy should never violate the human rights of anyone.
column26: O1: Democrat, O2: 35-44, O3: Suburban, older democrats

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: As a significant country/leaders in the world, I think it's in the USA's interests to try to help defend human rights. Everyone has a right to live a safe, peaceful life. However, I do not agree with military involvement or sending weapons etc. I only agree with providing humanitarian support.
column26: O1: Democrat, O2: 25-34, O3: Urban, young democrats

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: Violations of human rights are like a disease.   If they are not destroyed early on they just spread.  We need to be proactive and not reactive.  It may not affect us directly right now, but eventually like most diseases, it will reach us.
column26: O1: Other/Independent, O2: 35-44, O3: Suburban, older independents

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: My thought on this is that all World Nations should be concerned about human rights not just America. We are all humans and some of us are not capable of protecting ourselves from aggressors and need help and it should be a collective effort by All Nations and if America wants to be the leader that's not an problem for me
column26: O1: Other/Independent, O2: 55-64, O3: Suburban, older independents

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: The act of defending human rights globally is a must due to the fact that if a superpower such as the USA doesn't do so, then who will? This will make the USA as a sought-after refugee spot for all foreign citizens of various countries that are under the effects of war, terror, genocide, and other inhumane conflicts/conditions.
column26: O1: Democrat, O2: 18-24, O3: Suburban, young democrats

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: Because we, in a position of power, should use our resources to help those in need.
column26: O1: Democrat, O2: 18-24, O3: Suburban, young democrats

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: I think that we need to be global citizens as well.  We need to help to ensure that all people are being treated humanly and not just our own citizens.
column26: O1: Republican, O2: 45-54, O3: Suburban, older republicans (>35)

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: I think protecting human rights is important no matter where in the world it is. I think America should do what is needed to protect people to an extent.
column26: O1: Republican, O2: 18-24, O3: Urban, young republicans (<35)

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: I think involving America with the conflicts in other countries helps ensure the safety of America in the long run. We should make sure that, globally, everyone has basic human rights that will help make the world a more peaceful place
column26: O1: Other/Independent, O2: 65+, O3: Rural, older independents

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: The simplest reason is we have built both a country, ideology and reputation for looking out for human rights. By doing so we stay true to ourselves and our belief system.
column26: O1: Other/Independent, O2: 35-44, O3: Rural, older independents

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: I feel supporting human rights across the globe is something to has to be done as a leader in international politics. It improves living conditions for those effected, and helps insure that negligent and dangerous behavior doesn't spread to other countries and governments. It absolutely has to be a focus for our leaders because I believe our position in the world requires us to support certain ideals across the planet, and fight against opposing and dangerous ideals abroad.
column26: O1: Democrat, O2: 35-44, O3: Urban, older democrats

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: It aligns with America values of equality and freedom, while also practicing deeper concepts such as compassion and reducing suffering. Also, it fosters economical stability in the long run
column26: O1: Other/Independent, O2: 35-44, O3: Urban, older independents

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: With great power comes great responsibility
column26: O1: Other/Independent, O2: 55-64, O3: Urban, older independents

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: As a global superpower I feel like we have some obligation to promote human rights globally - who else has the means to enforce it?
column26: O1: Other/Independent, O2: 25-34, O3: Suburban, young independents

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: I think that defending human rights  make the world a better place
column26: O1: Republican, O2: 45-54, O3: Urban, older republicans (>35)

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: I think it's good to offer humanitarian aid to places experiencing conflicts.
column26: O1: Republican, O2: 45-54, O3: Rural, older republicans (>35)

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: it's critical that human rights be protected, especially when countries are unable to offer this protection. As the leader of the free world it is our responsibility to protect those who can't protect themselves.
column26: O1: Democrat, O2: 55-64, O3: Suburban, older democrats

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: As a world power, we have the responsibility to watch out for people whose human rights are being violated.  Very few countries in the world are able to take on such a role, so we need to step up.
column26: O1: Democrat, O2: 55-64, O3: Urban, older democrats

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: I believe human rights need to be protected and at time defended particularly in smaller countries threatened by stronger and larger ones.
column26: O1: Democrat, O2: 55-64, O3: Suburban, older democrats

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: Human rights are basic to a good and shared life amongst all.  It is a better world when human rights are accepted by all rather than stifled by a few.  When we trample human rights we risk falling victim to authoritarian regimes which seek to limit human rights.
column26: O1: Democrat, O2: 65+, O3: Rural, older democrats

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: This is a basic level of support, absent of politics or religion, on the ground level human to human level. All countries should support this.
column26: O1: Democrat, O2: 65+, O3: Suburban, older democrats

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: The USA is the most powerful country in the world. The most prosperous. The leader of the free world. The only reason why we have a hegemony on the world stage is because of our involvement in global affairs. This includes defending human rights globally.
column26: O1: Democrat, O2: 25-34, O3: Suburban, young democrats

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: I think we should protect the rights and freedoms of people across the world. Not every nation has the advantages America has had and may not have the resources required to defend from people who seek to hurt others for their beliefs or for gaining territory.
column26: O1: Other/Independent, O2: 18-24, O3: Suburban, young independents

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: With the resources we have. We should play some sort of role to help others that are being oppressed
column26: O1: Democrat, O2: 18-24, O3: Suburban, young democrats

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: I think it is important for the US to support human rights on a global scale. We need to help ensure that basic human rights are available all over the world. The US should partner with other countries to help those that need help with this issue.
column26: O1: Democrat, O2: 35-44, O3: Suburban, older democrats

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: The United States is the gatekeeper of humanity in the World.
column26: O1: Republican, O2: 55-64, O3: Suburban, older republicans (>35)

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: I think that everyone has a right to human rights.  And we are one world that needs to do a better job helping each other take care of each other
column26: O1: Republican, O2: 55-64, O3: Suburban, older republicans (>35)

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: America has been responsible for much suffering across the world. We should also be responsible for helping to undo the harm we have done.
column26: O1: Other/Independent, O2: 25-34, O3: Urban, young independents

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: The world should have human rights
column26: O1: Republican, O2: 55-64, O3: Rural, older republicans (>35)

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: I think we all need to be available to help each other with human rights and conflicts regarding them. Human rights  are protected and legal rights we all have.
column26: O1: Republican, O2: 55-64, O3: Rural, older republicans (>35)

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: Because we are all connected.  What is happening in one part of the world will affect us al in one way or another. We can also not let one country or it's dictators become to strong as they will keep commiting crimes and spreading elsewhere.
column26: O1: Other/Independent, O2: 45-54, O3: Suburban, older independents

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: We're going through one of the worse human rights crisis now, and I believe it's important for people in power such as Americans to use their platform to right the wrong of treating others lesser than. All humans have rights and this should be fought for.
column26: O1: Democrat, O2: 35-44, O3: Suburban, older democrats

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: Basic human rights (safety, shelter, food, water, education, etc) should be allowed everywhere and should be global policy

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: Because I think that human rights are a basic right and there are a lot of people who aren’t able or do not have the power to have their rights stood up for so we should help those who can’t

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: This is because we need to protect the right of humans.
column26: O1: Republican, O2: 35-44, O3: Urban, older republicans (>35)

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: international stability which means countries that respects human rights are often more stable and less prone to conflicts. Promoting human rights can contribute to global peace.
column26: O1: Republican, O2: 45-54, O3: Urban, older republicans (>35)

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: People everywhere demand to live in dignity. When people of all walks of life have access to nutritious food, clean water, adequate shelter, and free of overburden due to rents and conflict they are able to live and work to their best ability. Supporting humans rights ultimately means supporting raising their standards in other ways which is capital.
column26: O1: Other/Independent, O2: 45-54, O3: Urban, older independents

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: America has a lot of rights and we should share that with the rest of the world
column26: O1: Other/Independent, O2: 18-24, O3: Urban, young independents

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: I believe that defending human rights globally should be a goal of American policy. As a leading global power, the United States has both the influence and the responsibility to promote and protect human rights. Upholding these rights aligns with American values of freedom, justice, and equality. Moreover, advocating for human rights helps foster global stability and peace, reducing the likelihood of conflicts that can have wide-reaching effects, including on American interests. Additionally, su
column26: O1: Democrat, O2: 45-54, O3: Urban, older democrats

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: The goal is close to or very well aligned with one of our founding principles, which is still the best statement about human rights and governance ever written.  Defending these rights could also help solidify our longer term relationships with allies or prospective allies, and possibly help deter any un-friendly/ corrupt forces from within those countries becoming dominant/ overthrowing friendlier, democratic regimes.
column26: O1: Republican, O2: 65+, O3: Suburban, older republicans (>35)

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: As a country with resources, we should help others that do not have as many resources. Regardless of the county, every human deserves human rights. Additionally forming ties in other countries may be important to us in the future and help protect ourselves as well.
column26: O1: Republican, O2: 18-24, O3: Rural, young republicans (<35)

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: I think we should support those that are in need of humane and fair human rights.  I don't necessarily think we should support them with military engagement.  I think it is the moral thing to do to try to help others, but not at the expense of our own country.
column26: O1: Republican, O2: 65+, O3: Suburban, older republicans (>35)

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: As a world leader, it’s a moral imperative to defend human rights globally. Unfortunately, The US has a tendency to only become involved with conflicts when we have a political, economic or other interest.
column26: O1: Democrat, O2: 55-64, O3: Urban, older democrats

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: Because everyone is entitled to certain basic rights
column26: O1: Other/Independent, O2: 35-44, O3: Suburban, older independents

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: I believe that America is responsible for many humanitarian crises, we should support defending human rights in places that we affected.
column26: O1: Other/Independent, O2: 18-24, O3: Urban, young independents

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: If we stand for what's right, that requires a global presence.
column26: O1: Other/Independent, O2: 25-34, O3: Rural, young independents

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad
column3: Please explain why you chose this answer (please be as specific as you can).
column5: If we are the leaders of the world then we need to ensure all people are treated humanely. Basic human rights is something we can't sit back and let get stripped away. It's the right thing to do.
column26: O1: Democrat, O2: 45-54, O3: Suburban, older democrats

Name: d43007ad-700d-4ed2-b51e-035e730eadad

column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: Some may disagree with promoting human rights globally as a primary goal of American policy due to prioritizing domestic needs first. Others question the effectiveness of interventions and critique selective approaches that seem to align with geopolitical interests rather than universal principles of human rights. There's also concern about unintended consequences and whether such actions truly lead to lasting improvements in human rights conditions worldwide.

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: they dont want US involved period.
column26: O1: Republican, O2: 45-54, O3: Suburban, older republicans (>35)

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: I think the cost of raising and maintaining an adequate navy causes some Americans to say the money can be better spent at home. This is not an irrational response but it is wrong. If our trading partners no longer have the freedom of navigation they enjoy today our prices for goods will increase. Maintaining a maritime fleet pays for itself though it's not always easy to see.
column26: O1: Other/Independent, O2: 45-54, O3: Urban, older independents

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5:
The resources are garnered from the US tax payers and therefore should be spent on US citizens.

Human rights are a fundamental element to all and should be protected.
column26: O1: Republican, O2: 45-54, O3: Suburban, older republicans (>35)

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: I believe the main reason for most people would be that we should just focus on ourselves.  They would say we aren't world police.   It's a narrow short-sighted approach, but I imagine that is their reasoning.
column26: O1: Other/Independent, O2: 35-44, O3: Suburban, older independents

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: Some people want America to be insular and ignore the world around us.
column26: O1: Democrat, O2: 55-64, O3: Suburban, older democrats

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: Because those in power want to maintain that power. Some may not understand the layers and the deceit that goes into maintaining that power. The US has historically funded both sides of many conflicts. The ones going on now are no different.
column26: O1: Other/Independent, O2: 55-64, O3: Rural, older independents

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: Non-americans often feel as if they are entitled to American defense capabilities, American resources, and American power... but they are not.  Those things should be given to American citizens first. Only American citizens are ENTITLED to any of those things.
column26: O1: Republican, O2: 55-64, O3: Urban, older republicans (>35)

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: I think that people would agree that the US has human rights violations, but they would disagree at the severity of it.
column26: O1: Democrat, O2: 45-54, O3: Suburban, older democrats

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: Because we should be spending money on ourselves
column26: O1: Democrat, O2: 25-34, O3: Urban, young democrats

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: they feel that the resources are for just Americans
column26: O1: Republican, O2: 25-34, O3: Urban, young republicans (<35)

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: People  might disagree for favor of local issues like homeless problems  illegal immigration.
column26: O1: Democrat, O2: 55-64, O3: Urban, older democrats

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: I think some people may believe we are doing good by getting involved, but it’s simply not true. Most nations are left in a worse position after our involvement. Nation building is a failed and corrupt concept.
column26: O1: Republican, O2: 35-44, O3: Suburban, older republicans (>35)

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: I think people want to uphold the current norms in the US even if it doesn't serve everyone and in particular are willing to disregard the impact on those outside the US because it's not impacting them directly, or at least it's not in a way that's tangible to them.
column26: O1: Democrat, O2: 35-44, O3: Suburban, older democrats

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: Some people stick to the ideal that we should always help as many countries as possible.
column26: O1: Other/Independent, O2: 35-44, O3: Suburban, older independents

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: I think that some people would disagree with me because a lot of Americans feel that the United States should be the world's police. They may feel that things are going well for us, and that we should have a presence everywhere around the world.
column26: O1: Other/Independent, O2: 35-44, O3: Rural, older independents

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: Some would think that the money spent on helping people abroad would be better spent at home here in the US.  Others might actually welcome an authoritarian regime.  For example, there are many religious folks who are eagerly awaiting a theocratic dictatorship in the name of their god to take over the world, so these ones are not necessarily bothered by limiting rights based on a theocratic worldview.
column26: O1: Democrat, O2: 65+, O3: Rural, older democrats

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: People who are well off and believe that we should remain active in abating terrorism abroad forget that someone has to pay the bill for all the tax money that is being given to Ukraine, etc.   That's coming from our pockets and some of us can't afford how expensive life has become. We are not responsible for the activities of another country.
column26: O1: Republican, O2: 55-64, O3: Rural, older republicans (>35)

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: they think we shouldn't waste our resources solving other people's problem
column26: O1: Democrat, O2: 35-44, O3: Suburban, older democrats

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: I think some people would argue that America's strength makes it a role model for other countries. If we get involved in protecting human rights in other countries, that might inspire other countries to help out as well.
column26: O1: Republican, O2: 25-34, O3: Suburban, young republicans (<35)

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: Some people would believe that it's not the US's job to police the world.
column26: O1: Democrat, O2: 45-54, O3: Suburban, older democrats

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: Some people fell that it’s our responsibility to fund every conflict and war and send our guys over to fight. There’s a lot of money to be made off these wars.
column26: O1: Republican, O2: 65+, O3: Rural, older republicans (>35)

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: that countries must prioritize their own security, economic interests
column26: O1: Republican, O2: 35-44, O3: Suburban, older republicans (>35)

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: people have different perspectives and some may think the people in the country comes first in terms of welfare  and others may say we should aid other countries because we are better off
column26: O1: Republican, O2: 25-34, O3: Urban, young republicans (<35)

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: Many argue that intervention in other countries' affairs violates the principle of national sovereignty.
column26: O1: Democrat, O2: 45-54, O3: Urban, older democrats

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: Because as a nation currently, there are many Americans who are struggling to just feed themselves.
column26: O1: Republican, O2: 35-44, O3: Rural, older republicans (>35)

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: Even though it can hurt the USA to enter a conflict, there is some good that comes from it. I don't think the USA should ever have been in the Middle East. When the USA left Afghanistan it caused a huge power vacuum and disrupted a lot of peoples lives living there. Women and children weren’t as safe as before. I think people would disagree with what I said previously because the idea of helping others outweighs the potential negative effects. People thought going to Vietnam was a good idea.
column26: O1: Other/Independent, O2: 25-34, O3: Urban, young independents

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: Some may disagree that promoting human rights internationally should be the top priority in US policy because they believe that national interests should come first, because they have different opinions on sovereignty, or because they don't think these initiatives will be successful in various cultural contexts.
column26: O1: Republican, O2: 65+, O3: Urban, older republicans (>35)

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: I think everyone agrees that people in other countries are important to consider but we must consider the people in our country first.
column26: O1: Republican, O2: 25-34, O3: Urban, young republicans (<35)

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: I think a lot of people agree that it's the morally right thing to do. Some may disagree because they are cynical of US intentions abroad, or they may think prioritizing domestic issues is more important.
column26: O1: Other/Independent, O2: 25-34, O3: Suburban, young independents

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: Some may disagree because they see these funds more valuable in use here in our country.
column26: O1: Other/Independent, O2: 45-54, O3: Suburban, older independents

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: Others might disagree and think we should just worry about ourselves
column26: O1: Republican, O2: 35-44, O3: Rural, older republicans (>35)

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: Some people take an isolationist point of view and feel we're not obligated to "be our brother's keeper."
column26: O1: Other/Independent, O2: 65+, O3: Suburban, older independents

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: “Helping” is not so simple. It often comes with risky military involvement, money being given away when we are already in massive debt, and sometimes can create war. Generally, I think many people are feeling more wary about the over-eager US military and the money we give to it, wanting to cut back on military pursuits and involvement throughout the world, but also wanting to help people.
column26: O1: Other/Independent, O2: 25-34, O3: Urban, young independents

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: Some people may think that human rights is important everywhere and we should always get involved.  Getting involved costs money and lives.
column26: O1: Republican, O2: 45-54, O3: Suburban, older republicans (>35)

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: Some people think we shouldn't spend any money on other countries but others think we should always be ready, able and willing to go to war.
column26: O1: Other/Independent, O2: 65+, O3: Suburban, older independents

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: Because some people think that the taxpayers should foot the living expenses for everyone else. Cases like the disabled for example I agree with supplying Healthcare and housing assistance but there must be limits on how much is given out. Otherwise you have a society thst relies on government handouts.
column26: O1: Other/Independent, O2: 35-44, O3: Suburban, older independents

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: Some people believe giving to those outside the country, will make America look weak and leave us open for those who could advantage of us.
column26: O1: Democrat, O2: 18-24, O3: Suburban, young democrats

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: In practice, getting involved with other countries often leads to rising tensions and conflicts. The underlying reasons for getting involved are often malicious/self-serving, and do not end well.
column26: O1: Democrat, O2: 25-34, O3: Urban, young democrats

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: Some say if we can't help ourselves then we can't help others.
column26: O1: Other/Independent, O2: 45-54, O3: Suburban, older independents

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: Isolationism, lack of education, a failure to understand international politics and how if can affect the US.
column26: O1: Democrat, O2: 65+, O3: Suburban, older democrats

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: They might think we need to mind our own store and focus on human rights issues here at home.  They might think the expense is too high.  They also might think we have a moral obligation to stay out of it as our way would not be better.
column26: O1: Republican, O2: 45-54, O3: Suburban, older republicans (>35)

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: Some people feel that it is the job of the USA to support other countries.
column26: O1: Republican, O2: 55-64, O3: Suburban, older republicans (>35)

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: Some people may disagree with the US defending human rights globally because they are taking more of an isolationist approach. They do not see how things that happen to people in other countries could have an effect on themselves.
column26: O1: Republican, O2: 55-64, O3: Suburban, older republicans (>35)

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: I believe some people might disagree with me and say that we should focus on bettering ourselves before helping others. In response I would say "Why does it have it have to be exclusive? Why does helping others mean we can't help ourselves at the same time? We can grow together and be stronger for it!"
column26: O1: Republican, O2: 18-24, O3: Rural, young republicans (<35)

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: Most people I know do not want others to suffer. We all agree that helping those in need is one of the most important areas in our life. Innocent children, elderly and those hurt need more than what was offered and most people know that those are the most vulernable.
column26: O1: Democrat, O2: 65+, O3: Suburban, older democrats

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: People think that America would be too selfish to ignore the problems with the suffering in other countries
column26: O1: Republican, O2: 55-64, O3: Suburban, older republicans (>35)

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: Some people feel strongly about issues they see happening around the world. I do too. It's not that I don't want to fight for human rights around the world, but it's hard to fight for other people's rights when one doesn't have rights of their own. I suppose some might say we should fight for rights in unison and still support people in other countries. The US and its actions seem to be more about political power than actions for the good of people.
column26: O1: Other/Independent, O2: 55-64, O3: Suburban, older independents

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: Agreement seems consistent when it comes to universal rights, even when you realize that these rights aren't respected in many countries, or have not been over many generations.  The overall goal is still to help establish human rights however you can.
column26: O1: Republican, O2: 65+, O3: Suburban, older republicans (>35)

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: They believe we are a global community and therefore should help our fellow citizens.
column26: O1: Other/Independent, O2: 55-64, O3: Rural, older independents

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: They believe that America being the strongest country in the world makes them the default enforcers, but they forget that America has major issues with racism, political infighting, and extreme classism.
column26: O1: Other/Independent, O2: 25-34, O3: Rural, young independents

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: Some people might disagree due to concerns about sovereignty issues, believing that each country should manage its internal affairs independently without external interference. Others may prioritize economic or strategic interests over human rights considerations, fearing that emphasizing human rights could strain diplomatic relations or compromise national interests. Additionally, cultural relativism could lead some to argue that universal human rights standards may not apply universally across
column26: O1: Democrat, O2: 55-64, O3: Urban, older democrats

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: They probably aren't concerned with the over all budget and feel like we should control everything regardless of how much we spend.
column26: O1: Republican, O2: 55-64, O3: Suburban, older republicans (>35)

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: Some may believe that America is the global life saver.
column26: O1: Republican, O2: 55-64, O3: Suburban, older republicans (>35)

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: we have a long history of getting involved in another countries affairs and the whole thing ending up worse than before we got involved.

column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: They could rightly point to the waste and corruption of the country (ies) that are receiving the aid.  Our own country could use some assistance in certain demographics.  Our debt is absolutely out of control and continuing to fund other countries problems isn't helping.

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec

column5: They think being global helps us in somekind of way. I dissagree

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: they might think its not needed

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: People have different perspectives when it comes to how they see things. some might say that we should mind our own business

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec

column5: There are selfish conspiracy theorists that believe we should ONLY invest in ourselves and ignore conflicts elsewhere. That's a great strategy for evolving current conflicts into WW III.

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec

column5: They are concerned about the costs and risks of intervention.

column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: the cost to the tax payer
column26: O1: Republican, O2: 45-54, O3: Urban, older republicans (>35)

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: I think that some people have a hard time looking beyond themselves.  I also think they are more concerned about their day to day lives then about the conditions other people have to live under.
column26: O1: Democrat, O2: 55-64, O3: Suburban, older democrats

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: There is a lack of understanding by US citizens how the global community sees the US and its heavy handed ways it conducts foreign policy. We have lost the moral high ground.

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: They think that solving other people's problems should be done on using our taxpayer money. Probably because it is the "right thing to do".
column26: O1: Democrat, O2: 25-34, O3: Suburban, young democrats

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: Would agree if they can see beyond borders, and would disagree if they only see the borders of US. Some people just don't think it's needed to help others in very unfortunate circumstances.

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: They think America should always come first and we shouldn't interfere with other countries.
column26: O1: Democrat, O2: 55-64, O3: Suburban, older democrats

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: People think that just because the US is powerful, that power should be used to help other people. While I agree to an extent, violence is just not the answer. I often wonder where that energy was centuries ago when certain groups didn't have any rights simply because of a skin color.

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: we all have different opinions and realities.

Name: 8dc0bcf6-192e-472b-bc8b-fafac8c658ec
column3: What are the reasons that you think some people would/might disagree with you?
column5: Some may believe that it leads to costly foreign interventions.
column26: O1: Republican, O2: 18-24, O3: Suburban, young republicans (<35)

column3: What actions, if any, should the U.S. take in the Democratic Republic of the Congo? Please explain your reason(s) for your answer.
column5: I don't know that sanctions have been successful in the case of Congo and that perhaps a more systemic approach needs to be taken to address bigger systems at play. So while I do think more pressure on Rwanda from the US would be good, addressing the US tech industry and market that's driving the desire for resources in Congo would also be productive as less demand would mean the resource exploitation in Congo would have less appeal and hopefully slow the conflict and the exploitation of people.

That probably starts with more media coverage.

column3: What actions, if any, should the U.S. take in the Democratic Republic of the Congo? Please explain your reason(s) for your answer.

column3: What actions, if any, should the U.S. take in the Democratic Republic of the Congo? Please explain your reason(s) for your answer.
column5: I agree, this issue is a tangled mess.  The DRC is riven my corruption and conflict between itself and other nations, as well as internally by ethnic and religious differences.  And we all turn a blind eye to the fact that the a large proportion of the cobalt, tantalum, and other extracted resources that underpin the manufacturing of our technology come from the DRC, mined often by children, in conditions that would be considered illegal and extremely hazardous in any developed nation.
